title: Heidelberg
text: My main destination was the castle.i walked from the train station through the route there and visited shops along the way as one nears the castle area. I missed the funicular ride up so hiked a very steep route. I bought the tour and don’t know how one would get in without having the tour. The guide was knowledgable and quite humorous. Interesting castle and it’s story. There is also a museum of pharmacy which is most enlightening. The castle grounds are enormous - a beautiful area with views of the city. Rode the funicular down and visited the shops in the way back. Had coffee and pastry at a lovely tea house on the way. I found Heidelberg a charming city.

title: Walking tour in Frankfurt
text: I thoroughly enjoyed our most informative tour of Frankfurt. Apologies that I have forgotten the name of our guide (American woman from PA, a new mom and married to German). She threaded our tour beautifully around the old town while adding much history and character of the city and its people. I enjoyed travel in Germany.
place: Frankfurt on Foot Daily Walking Tour in English

title: Symbol of democracy
text: The Acropolis is the highest point in Athens and as one mounts the hill you see the Parthanon, the Erecththeion, the Propylaia and the temple of Athena. The temples honor the virgin Athena. This remarkable architecture dates back to the 5th century BC. What remains are remnants of their grandeur but they still hold their magnificence and the symbol of democracy born in Ancient Greece. The Theatre of Dionysus lies south or below the top of the hill. This was an important part of the Greeks life. I do recommend a visit to the Acropolis Museum just below the hill.

title: Heart of the city
text: Had such fun in this old town where I stayed as well. The streets are narrow and winding full of small shops and restaurants. Juxtaposed to one area of fully modern stores one can find the ancient agora with hundreds of flea market/bazaar stalls and more restaurants. I found the food excellent and everything reasonably priced. Close by are the many ancient treasures of Athens. Wonderful to observe the ‘changing of the guard’ at the palace and stroll through a wonderful city park - all an easy walk.

title: Superb museum
text: I loved my visit here. The building is a sensation and the artifacts quite incredible. Entrance is very inexpensive. The restaurant was wonderful. I had an excellent meal and we lunch guests were treated by a harpist making beautiful music. Memorable indeed.

title: Birthday dinner treat
text: Clinkerdagger restaurant is a jolly fun establishment (old English decor) with super staff along with exceptional food. It is a special treat to dine there. I particularly love their prime rib with all the fixings. From soups, salads, entrees to dessert- one can't go wrong. Try to get seating high over the river too - spectacular!

title: Good coffee
text: Must stop when seeking a break downtown Spokane. Have a coffee and a sweet after musing over the endless array of unusual gifts and books. A shop of distinction and interest to list everyone. Next stop Boo Radley next door.

title: The best of pizza!
text: Have frequented the Flame and Cork several times and always thoroughly enjoyed the pizza and wine. They have an interesting variety of both. The staff are attentive and there is a good ambiance in the restaurant..

title: Eclectic
text: This is a must stop on a visit to downtown Spokane. Best coffee and sweets anywhere and friendly service in casual atmosphere. Terrific gift items, books, candy and real novelty merchandise. Atticus has been in town for ages - 30 or more years.

title: Superb
text: One of the best meals we've had in a long time. I had seafood, he had steak as well as an appetizer plate and cheese dish for dessert. Excellent service and the entrees were wonderful.

title: Satisfying Mexican dinner
text: Four of us stopped in for supper and all ordered different items. Every entree was quite satisfying and typical 'American Mexican' food. We ate outside on the patio which was pleasant and the service was good. Enjoyed our margaritas too. Though the facility is well kept the building is showing its age.

title: Over the top!
text:
We had the works and it was all deliciously wonderful. An evening to remember.
My partner ordered steak and I the fish entrée- both beautifully prepared. Service was exceptional while we felt most relaxed with coffee and cheese plate. It is special.

title: Friendly and reasonable.
text:
A good and friendly 19th hole stop. The cafe offers all spirits and good sandwiches.
We enjoy a bite and a drink after a round of golf and usually sit on the expansive terrace overlooking the driving range. The staff are friendly and aim to please.

title: The best in Provo
text:
We have dined at this restaurant several times and never been disappointed. The service is the best - most accommodating.
We've had breakfast and lunch. The food was exceptional - wholesome, interesting offerings and so good. Though not fancy it is a comfortable venue.

title: Home away
text: Extremely comfortable accomodation for an extended time during a move. Great space for diverse family setup. Several bedrooms with bathrooms and ample kitchen and sitting room. Pool great. Very good breakfasts provided with expansive offerings. A small store of food items were on premise too.

title: Manito plant sale day
text: Always love to visit Manito Park. In the heart of the city such a large diverse green space. At one side the Japanese gardens which are beautiful and a refreshing interlude. On the other the botanical greenhouse, rose gardens and formal sunken garden. In between one can enjoy the duck ponds, play areas and heavenly park space. It is a great way to spend a morning or afternoon.

title: Great book store
text: This is a marvelous book store with so many titles and a fun place to stop for coffee and a treat. We are so lucky to have this store.

title: Topnotch service and excellent food.
text:
We were a group of four and everyone enjoyed an excellent meal with superb service.
The whole staff were extremely friendly. The venue is not large but we were most comfortable and not rushed at all. The bar is at the other end of the area and not a noise issue.

title: Fun place, good food and excellant service.
text: Had a very good meal there in December. The house was full and we were late joining a group. The staff seated us and had our orders up quite near the rest of the table.

title: Heart of Coeur d'Alene
text: Visited the resort in December with my guests. Enjoyed the Christmas lights and busy lobby. Love the warm ambience of the Dockside restaurant with view above the water of beautiful lake Coeur d'Alene. Dinner was excellent and the service the same. Wish the salad bar was not in the line of traffic.

title: Area treasure
text: We are lucky to have this wonderful trail for bike and pedestrian use. The trail hugs the lake front in many places and allows passage for many miles from Spokane through Coeur d'Alene.

title: The best midday meal around.
text: Though the venue is of limited seating the cafe has a very loyal following and does a brisk lunch business. It is a bright and clean spot with a case full of freshly made salads, offerings of a couple of soups each day and a menu of hot and cold sandwiches of the South American style. Every meal I have had there has been delicious. The service is quick and the staff really friendly. Only open throughout the week - no weekends.

title: Good neighborhood restaurant.
text: I like it best for breakfast though they do all the favorite dishes well for lunch and dinner too. The service is good and one can customize their order usually. Always clean and presentable. Find of late the establishment sadly getting a little pricey.

title: Always look forward to a meal at Bardenay. Consistent good food and service and atmosphere.
text: Bardenay offers more than the standard fare. The dishes are original, well presented and tasty at reasonable prices. The restaurant is low key but classy too. Love the food, drink and location. They are open later than most other venues in town.

title: Fun place, great food and the best service - any time!
text: Capone's offers a wide variety on their menu. Tried the soup of the day which was so good. Friend had burger and another french dip which were both highly rated. New place in Hayden is fun and the service is the best .

title: A must experience
text: Hudson's is a Coeur 'Alene landmark and been in the same spot for one hundred years. It is as much the experience as it is the food. There is inevitably a line up during much of the day waiting for a seat at one of a dozen or so stools inside. There is a limited menu but the hundred year process is the same and much of the experience is watching the preparation of your burger. I often note many patrons order two of their favorite burgers. It is a great burger - fresh and oh so good.

title: Wonderful pizza
text:
Not your traditional pizza. It is quite distinct and wonderful - always tasty with a thin, crisp crust.
The service is always cordial and good. There is rarely a wait for ones order. I recommend it wholeheartedly. It is located on Sherman Avenue and a handy location for anyone. It isn't too noisy like a lot of pizza places. I like the mushroom pizza especially well.q

title: Consistently good food and good service.
text: For a good and reasonably priced meal this is the best in town. I always enjoy my meal at Moon Time and enjoy a wide selection of entrees.

title: Most enthusiastic and informative tour in the city!
text: You brought life to the area history in such an interesting way. We toured a great section and would love to do your other tour.
